metadata.title: CVE-2020-36138 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in decode_frame in libavcodec/tiff.c in FFmpegversion 4.3, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (DoS).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36138` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavformat58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavutil56 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libswresample3 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libswscale5 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4-6ubuntu5').
